inherit.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
inherit.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He inherited a fortune from his grandmother.
inherit.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if you inherit a situation, especially one in which problems have been caused by other people, you have to deal with it
inherit.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The present government inherited a closed, state-dominated economy.
inherit.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to have the same character or appearance as your parents
inherit.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I inherited my mother’s curly hair.
Mr. Grass inherited his work ethic from his father.
inherit.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to get something that someone else does not want anymore
inherit.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: We inherited the furniture from the previous tenants.
inherit.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to receive money or property from someone after they have died
inherit.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: She will inherit her father’s entire fortune when he dies.
We built the house on land inherited from our uncle.
inherit.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to start being in charge of something that was previously controlled by another person
inherit.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The incoming president inherited a healthy economy.
Problems he inherited from his predecessor led to the bank’s later troubles.
